ContentServer
public class ContentServerWcImpl
extends AbstractContentServerWcImpl
implements ContentServer

Represents a specific instance of a Web Center data store.

Since:
11.1.1.7.3

Constructor Detail

ContentServerWcImpl

public ContentServerWcImpl()
Create a new Web Center Content Repository using the Web Center's primary connection.

ContentServerWcImpl

public ContentServerWcImpl(ContentServerConnectionWcImpl connection)
Create a new Web Center Content Repository using the connection passed in. If the connection passed in is empty then it attempts to create a repository based on Web Center's primary connection.

Parameters:
connection - used to construct repository.

closeConnection

public void closeConnection()

Use the following pattern when interacting with the Web Center Content Repository to ensure thread safety and best performance:

WebCenterServer cr = null; try { WebCenterConnection conn = new WebCenterConnection(); cr = new WebCenterServer(conn); cr.doSomething(); } finally { cr.closeConnection(); }

Use the following pattern when interacting with the Web Center Content Repository to ensure thread safety and best performance:

WebCenterServer cr = null; try { WebCenterConnection conn = new WebCenterConnection(); cr = new WebCenterServer(conn); cr.doSomething(); } finally { cr.closeConnection(); }

Specified by:
closeConnection in interface ContentServer
Overrides:
closeConnection in class AbstractContentServerWcImpl
See Also:
to construct ContentServer classes in a more generic manner.

setSignRequired

public void setSignRequired(boolean signRequired)
Description copied from interface: ContentServer
Set this values to indicate whether the request to the Content Server needs to be signed. Setting this to true indicates that request to the Content Server will be trusted.

Specified by:
setSignRequired in interface ContentServer
Parameters:
signRequired - true iff request to the content server are to be signed.

isSignRequired

public boolean isSignRequired()
Description copied from interface: ContentServer
Indicates whether requests to the Content Server are to be trusted.

Specified by:
isSignRequired in interface ContentServer
Returns:
true iff request to the content server are to be signed.

Description copied from interface: ContentServer
Uploads a rendition to the Content Server.

Specified by:
upload in interface ContentServer
Parameters:

input - The contents of the file being uploaded.
